com.vaadin.fluent.api

Interface FluentHasItems<THIS extends FluentHasItems<THIS,ITEM>,ITEM>

  • Type Parameters:
    THIS - Self-referential generic THIS
    ITEM - The item type in the listing
    All Superinterfaces:
    com.vaadin.server.ClientConnector, com.vaadin.ui.Component, com.vaadin.shared.Connector, FluentComponent<THIS>, FluentSizeable<THIS>, com.vaadin.data.HasItems<ITEM>, Serializable, com.vaadin.server.Sizeable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FluentAbstractListing<THIS,ITEM>, FluentAbstractMultiSelect<THIS,VALUE>, FluentAbstractSingleSelect<THIS,VALUE>, FluentCheckBoxGroup<THIS,VALUE>, FluentComboBox<THIS,ITEM>, FluentGrid<THIS,ITEM>, FluentHasDataProvider<THIS,ITEM>, FluentHasFilterableDataProvider<THIS,ITEM,FILTER>, FluentHasHierarchicalDataProvider<THIS,ITEM>, FluentListSelect<THIS,ITEM>, FluentNativeSelect<THIS,ITEM>, FluentRadioButtonGroup<THIS,ITEM>, FluentTree<THIS,ITEM>, FluentTreeGrid<THIS,ITEM>, FluentTwinColSelect<THIS,ITEM>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FCheckBoxGroup, FComboBox, FGrid, FListSelect, FNativeSelect, FRadioButtonGroup, FTree, FTreeGrid, FTwinColSelect

    public interface FluentHasItems<THIS extends FluentHasItems<THIS,ITEM>,ITEM>
extends com.vaadin.data.HasItems<ITEM>, FluentComponent<THIS>
    The base interface for fluent versions of HasItems

    • Method Detail

      • withItems

        default THIS withItems(Collection<ITEM> items)
        Sets the data items of this component provided as a collection.

        The provided items are wrapped into a ListDataProvider and this instance is used as a data provider for the setDataProvider(DataProvider) method. It means that the items collection can be accessed later on via ListDataProvider.getItems(): 

         
 HasDataProvider<String> listing = new CheckBoxGroup<>();
 listing.setItems(Arrays.asList("a","b"));
 ...

 Collection<String> collection = ((ListDataProvider<String>)listing.getDataProvider()).getItems();

        The provided collection instance may be used as-is. Subsequent modification of the collection might cause inconsistent data to be shown in the component unless it is explicitly instructed to read the data again.

        Parameters:
        items - the data items to display, not null
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        HasItems.setItems(Collection)

      • withItems

        default THIS withItems(ITEM... items)
        Sets the data items of this listing.

        The provided items are wrapped into a ListDataProvider and this instance is used as a data provider for the setDataProvider(DataProvider) method. It means that the items collection can be accessed later on via ListDataProvider.getItems(): 

         
 HasDataProvider<String> listing = new CheckBoxGroup<>();
 listing.setItems("a","b");
 ...

 Collection<String> collection = ((ListDataProvider<String>)listing.getDataProvider()).getItems();

        Parameters:
        items - the data items to display
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        HasItems.setItems(Object...)

      • withItems

        default THIS withItems(Stream<ITEM> streamOfItems)
        Sets the data items of this listing provided as a stream.

        This is just a shorthand for HasItems.setItems(Collection), that collects objects in the stream to a list. Thus, using this method, instead of its array and Collection variations, doesn't save any memory. If you have a large data set to bind, using a lazy data provider is recommended. See BackEndDataProvider for more info.

        The provided items are wrapped into a ListDataProvider and this instance is used as a data provider for the setDataProvider(DataProvider) method. It means that the items collection can be accessed later on via ListDataProvider.getItems(): 

         
 HasDataProvider<String> listing = new CheckBoxGroup<>();
 listing.setItems(Stream.of("a","b"));
 ...

 Collection<String> collection = ((ListDataProvider<String>)listing.getDataProvider()).getItems();

        Parameters:
        streamOfItems - the stream of data items to display, not null
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        HasItems.setItems(Stream)
